730331f-a.title: General view - East Broadway - South.
730331f-a.text:
A general (Bird's Eye) view, south from East Broadway, at Pike Street, showing on the left the East River and on the right the Hudson River. Al1 the piers south from the Manhattan Bridge are seen and the Brooklyn Bridge midway between the Battery (southern extremity of Manhattan).  The Manhattan Bridge is in the foreground. (The Manhattan Bridge extends from between Market and Pike Streets, to the Williamsburg Section of the Borough of Kings). The Brooklyn Bridge extends from near North William and Frankfort Streets, to the Borough
of Kings (Brooklyn).
1927.
International News.
730331f-a.folder: East Broadway and Pike Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

719419f-a.text:

September 10, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

719418f-a.text:
113 East Broadway, adjoining the S.W. corner of Pike Street, showing solely the entrance to same. Note the M. D.’s shingle in
the window at the left.
March 30, 1937
Berenice Abbott, photo
Federal Art Project

719414f-c.text:
(1)
East Broadway, north side, at, adjoining and west of the N.W.
corner of Pike Street.
July 25, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same view, at a later date, showing buildings demolished.
Allen Street, is seen in the backgroind.
September 7, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 1. Note the Ave. B. Street Car.
July 25, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
